Title: Bar closed early, breakfast weak

Positive_reviews: Â Check in was fast, and easy. Receptionist was informative and very helpful. Myself, and partner ate food and enjoyed some drinks at the â€œWhite Barâ€ situated in the lobby area, food was very nice, expensive but it was good. The facilities were great, the gym was spacious and had a good variety of machines, didnâ€™t manage to use the spa. But, both were complimentary with a nights stay. We ordered breakfast to our room at no extra charge, after paying at reception for it, the price was around Â£20 for us both. We ordered for 9am, and it was delivered bang on the time. The food was hot and nice, we received extras including croissants, fruit, orange juice and toast with a variety of sauces and jams. Although, we had both ordered coffees and this didnâ€™t come with our breakfast. Overall, it was a pleasant experience and stay.
Negative_reviews: Â Upon arrival of the property, there was a strange odour within the lobby area that myself and partner both noticed and said. We stayed on the fifth floor and there was also a strong smell of paint right a long the corridor, the paint smell canâ€™t be helped obviously and there was plenty of signs to indicate what was still wet etc, but the smell in the lobby wasnâ€™t the best start - wasnâ€™t unbearable but wasnâ€™t pleasant either. Our room was okay, it seemed quite dated and was clean enough. One of our bathroom lights was broke and flicked constantly when switched on, the tube needs replaced (room 508 - floor 5). Our bed was very low to the ground, and slanted. It felt as though I was a lot higher up than my partner, but I think this reason was because it was two king beds that had been pushed together to create the double. The pillows, and quilts were both comfortable and warm though. In the morning after what was an okay sleep we went to make a coffee each, when we had a look at the tea and coffee condiments there was a handful of different teas, plenty of sugar and sweetener but only one sachet of coffee, I donâ€™t know if this was a mistake or the normality but was a problem for us as we both enjoy a coffee in the morning, what made it worse was that we had also ordered two with our breakfasts in the morning to the room, and it turned up without any coffee, and instead just orange juice which we didnâ€™t order. Check out was fine and again pleasant, and we are certain that if we raised the issue with a member of staff they would have been kind enough to sort our demands. It wasnâ€™t the best stay but canâ€™t fault the staff, I just think I have for sure stayed in better Radissonâ€™s elsewhere in different cities than this one and they have perhaps set a higher standard than this particular establishment.

Positive_reviews: Â The location was just perfect for where we wanted to be in Liverpool. Just around the corner from the panoramic 34 restaurant. Very close to the liver building and a short stroll to the Albert Dock and to all the shops. Parking was separate but only Â£13 for 24 hours in a secure car park close by. The use of the swimming pool, sauna and steam room was good. Breakfast was good. We asked for a quiet room and it was the most quiet room I have ever had in a hotel and slept very well.
Negative_reviews: Â What I found most bizarre was on checking out my husband and I were asked to wait in reception area so that a telephone call could be made for someone to check our room for damage before they would give us our deposit back. We are both 60 years old and hardly look like hell raisers! We were both made to feel like criminals. I have never experienced this in any hotel Iâ€™ve stayed in all over the world. In fact in the last eight weeks I have stayed in 12 hotels and never made to feel like this. Suffice to say that our room was immaculately left and we were given our deposit back eventually.

Positive_reviews: Â The hotel was quite a distance from the main part of town and although we walked to Albert Dock on a couple of occasions it was easier to grab a taxi, however, the parking was only Â£13 for off site secure parking for 24 hours and for that we thought it was very good.  The staff were generally ok but Claire on reception was fabulous.  She was really helpful and gave us pointers of what we should do and deserves a gold star for her CRM.
Negative_reviews: Â We asked for a pillow at 8pm and after 3 hours and 2 phone calls it finally turned up.  The tv in our room didn't work and the bedside light didn't work.  We reported all of this and were given the few pounds back that we had paid for the upgrade to the superior room.  What I didn't understand was that we stayed for 3 nights and the first night we paid Â£229 for a superior riverside room and the only difference between that and the next rooms (at a cost of Â£149 per room per night) was that it was 4 floors higher!

Title: Wonderful

Positive_reviews:
Â The breakfast wasn't worth the money. Too many muesli style cereals, and the scrambled egg was AWFUL. It was very pale so there was obviously too much milk in it and it was sticky and heavy. It was served everyday except one, and surely the amount of scrambled egg being left uneaten on plates tells you something?? I asked for a fried egg, and that was OK, but if there was any chance of a cooked to order omlette, I didn't see the sign. There wasn't much fresh fruit, and it was mostly the same. Finally, I know coffee machines are a labour-saving device, but for the cost of the breakfast and the star rating of the hotel, It was not OK to be using a coffee machine, similar to one I saw the other day in Kwik-Fit!!
I've had better breakfasts with more variety in 3* hotels in Egypt and Greece. Start taking breakfast seriously, pull your socks up.

Negative_reviews: Â After a 5 hour drive from wales to Liverpool for a funeral, I arrived at this hotels reception to be told that the room the I had booked and paid for upfront was not available. I had booked a premium room with river view and obviously a double bed for me and my wife , only to be told by staff on arrival that they can only offer us a standard room with single beds and no view . I expressed that this was not good enough and I had already paid for the room , just to be told that the best they could do was push the beds together for us . No apology !  At this point it was 12:30 am and me and the wife were far to tired to argue , so we agreed and went up to the room . The following morning I confronted staff about my concerns only to be told the rooms are no different and just offered a complimentary free breakfast during our stay ğŸ˜‚. The hotel itself is of a good standard, but staff working there most definitely need better training when it comes to customer service. Me and the wife will not be using their hotels again .

Title: Wonderful

One of my favourite things about stay here is the comfort of the rooms, especially the beds. Warning: if you plan on staying up late to do work, stay far away from the bed because once the the blackout curtains are closed and you get slightly comfy on the bed I guarantee you will be out like a light. Check out time being 12pm is brilliant as it gives you that little extra time in the comfy beds. Will be staying again when I have an excuse.

Title: Pleasant

Negative_reviews: Â Nowhere at the time of booking, or in my non refundable booking confirmation email did it state that the credit card that was used for payment, would need to be presented at the time of check in.  I made this booking from Melbourne, Australia and this was a Christmas gift for my parents who live in Liverpool, England.  I noted that it would not be me who would be checking in, and gave the booking contact name and details.  When my parents attempted to check in, there were told that they had to pay for the room as they didn't have my credit card.  They were hit with a $311.61 (1 hundred and 72 pound) bill!!  My parents called me immediately and I spoke with Dinah on reception who was rude and unhelpful and passed the blame to Booking.com for not providing the hotel payment policy correct information.  I was told to call back on Monday (the booking was for a Saturday) and that I would need to speak with the hotel accounts team.  Since my booking was non refundable, even if my parents refused to stay, I would have still been charged!!  My Mum paid the $311.61 on her credit card and they continued with their planned hotel stay.  They had a really nice time, but the whole trip was tainted by the first encounter and the worry that they had to foot a very expensive hotel stay, when they only lived 40 minutes out of the city!  I called the accounts team as advised by Dinah on Monday and spoke to a really helpful lady called Natalia who apologized for the incident, processed a refund on Mums card and confirmed that the payment would be taken from my card, as originally planned.  The whole incident was very stressful and took the excitement, fun, and Christmas cheer away from the fact that this was supposed to be a Christmas present - it cut into my parents spending money and they spent the rest of the day/night being very careful with what they spent just incase the refund request was declined on the Monday when I was advised to call.

I did pay for a valet service that I am not receiving in its entirety".  It's simply good customer service and I didn't receive it. Instead, I felt a bit insulted! Title: We found the open plan nature of the hotel was not conducive to a good night's sleep! Too noisy!

Positive_reviews: Â Bed v comfy, pillows likewise, front desk staff very friendly and helpful, pool and spa very pleasant (pool not big but good enough to swim lengths in a fairly dedicated manner), lifts good, overall quiet hotel, position quite good, parking facility useful, restaurant choice of meals quite good, breakfast choice excellent, overall cleanliness excellent.
Negative_reviews: Â The room information was erroneous in that it said there was a fridge, but the policy has changed and all the fridges have been decommissioned. The front desk staff are happy to put things in a small fridge but you have to keep going up and down for that. There is a small ice bucket in the room with ice stations on each landing. Not anything like as good as having a fridge in the room though (we'd had plans for keeping some picnic-type stuff in the fridge and had to abandon that idea.)  The TVs were not working properly while we were there and this was a total hotel problem (except for the bar area) and the technicians were having trouble putting it right. We feel it was too expensive for what was on offer, although that is just a personal view. (Having said that, it you make good use of the pool and gym you are recouping a bit of the expense!) The restaurant was probably a bit on the dear side (but then so are a lot of eating places around the centre - we checked some of them out in passing). Finally, some might find it a little further away from the centre and main part of the waterfront than desired (incl. the river cruise start point opposite the Liver Building which is 12 mins' walk away, also the hop-on hop-off bus start points, and the Museum of Liverpool. The National Trust minibus tour of the Beatles Houses starts from Jury's Inn which is 25 mins' brisk walk away near Albert Dock, and the John Lewis area of shops would be about 20 mins. The cathedrals would probably be about 25 - 30 minutes' walk - bit less coming back as you are going downhill!)  - so check out the position to be sure, before booking. As it happened we didn't mind at all once we'd got our bearings, and we walked miles all over Liverpool (felt like it anyway!) and it was quite convenient to get back to. Otherwise it is not hard to get a taxi.

Negative_reviews: Â We didn't like that the restaurant staff made us feel un-welcome. Â i booked this stay to celebrate my fiancee birthday and our engagement in one. we arrived at 12 and had got told we cant check in till 2pm, which was fine as we were early so we decided to go into Liverpool as it was our first time here, we then came back and got told to wait over an hour again for our room as it weren't ready again,,, so we asked if we could go swimming, baring in mind half of the day had already nearly been gone. we came back from swimming at 15:45 on purpose to allow the hotel to prepare for our room. we then came in to a very large queue, i went to the front and said you already have our details so can we just have our key please and was told the systems had gone down and had to wait just over half an hour again in the queue. no drinks were offered out of good will or apologies. this is poor customer service and because this was a special occasion im even more annoyed this was the experience we got in Liverpool for the first time. 
so we entered our room once the day had pretty much gone, and seen that there were petals on the bed which was amazing yet i got told prior to booking this hotel that no one is allowed to enter the room to decorate for our special occasion because of covid, yet someone was allowed to put petals on the bed where we sleep?
im really just not happy and would prefer our money back. we had little time in the hotel and the experience was ruined from the moment we arrived.

When we went for a meal at night time, we enjoyed our meal, it was excellent. We were given a receipt to sign and note our room number, and we just assumed we would pay in the morning on checkout. We were wrong. After our meal we received a phone call to ask to come down and pay, which wasn't a problem. I arrived to pay the bill and I apologised for the misunderstanding, to which I got a look as if I had just stabbed her cat. No pleasantries exchanged there anyway. Also the showers are like a kid pouring water on you from a very small cup.

Finally, we were recommend The Capital carpark by the hotel - absolute nightmare getting out and is not a 4min walk as advised. Title: A Good hotel but below expectations.

Positive_reviews: Â Room was clean, and spacious.   Bed reasonably comfortable, as were pillows.  TV decent size with decent channel selection.  Plenty of hanging space in wardrobe.  Plenty of plug sockets, additional USB sockets would be advantageous too.
Negative_reviews: Â I'd thought that I'd pre booked breakfast when I booked the room, but it turned out that I hadn't. The receptionist was pretty snotty with me when I asked for a couple of minutes to double check my emails to ensure that I hadn't booked breakfast, and didn't end up paying again.  She was just desperate to charge us an extortionate amount rather than wait for me to check.  In hindsight I wish I hadn't have purchased breakfast anyway as it wasn't great.  Undercooked bacon, overcooked tomatoes and hash browns.... empty fruit selections.  I should have saved my money and found another establishment to have breakfast.  Location was further out of the city centre than I had hoped, and it was a nightmare to get to and from.  View of docks from our room (specifically booked a river view)  blocked by building works over the road.  Bathroom needed some attention...wasn't spotless as I'd assume, and once housekeeping had been done on our second day, only half of the tiles had been replenished. I lost count of the amount of times I tripped on the small step into the bathroom.  Re; the bed, an additional blanket would have been nice, half the duvet inside didn't fill the duvet cover, and we ended up with just cover either side of the duvet. . I wouldn't book this location again.

Title: Exceptional

Positive_reviews: Â Was easy to find with nearby shops for convenience.  The reception area and the bar were nicely decorated.
Negative_reviews: Â The rooms were very dated, with no plugs anywhere near the bed.  This is my pet hate in the 21st century!!  The air conditioning was poor and very noisy.  The facilities in the room were very basic, the mini-bar/fridge had been removed and there was no complementary water.  There were no additional pillows and when we requested some from reception they failed to turn up.  The hotel is based in a largely business area that is being heavily renovated so there are few restaurants, bars or other facilities nearby.  The road outside the hotel was closed due to construction and the nearest car-park was supposed to be 5 mins walk away but was more like 10.  The breakfast was a very basic buffet which was all self-service including coffee and toast so was more like a Service Station than a Radisson Blu.  The restaurant seating was a very odd design with tables of two sat almost next to each other.  The two coffee machines produced individual cups at a very, very slow rate, individually grinding each cup.  Jugs of coffee served by waiting staff would be far more efficient and a much better service to customers.  There were only scrambled eggs on the buffet and no additional options presented, the hash browns were anaemic and it was like a treasure hunt to find small plates for the cold food.  All in all a disappointing experience when compared to other hotels in the chain that we've stayed at.
Title: Disappointing for a Radisson Blu - over-priced.

Negative_reviews:
Â We ordered room service using their app system, I went downstairs to check how to pay, as we hadn't left them card details. They checked the order and arranged to bring a card machine up, though I also drew cash just in case.
After nearly 2 hours I enquired when the food would arrive, they phoned 10 mins later and told me they hadn't received the order, and could sort it in 20 mins.
The food was okay, expensive for what it was, and there was a Â£4 service charge included. If we do stay with Radisson Blu again, we'll be ordering from outside the hotel, as we were considering just going out for food by the time it arrived.

Title: It was "ok"

Positive_reviews: Â Breakfast. Foyer.
Negative_reviews: Â I had booked two rooms, one double (river view) and one twin standard. using the booking assistant I asked for the standard to be twin beds, and did not specify on the double (which came only with double anyway). Checked in at 10pm and asked whether the rooms I asked for were correct, to which the receptionist said yes. Once entering rooms I realised that the they were both twin. after calling reception, they would not agree that there was a fault or tries to accommodate us accordingly. In fact, their response was to sort out with Booking.com, which is poor customer service. One of the rooms did not have any shower gel, just shampoo and conditioner. the same room did not have working AC and the maintenance guy offered me a fan instead, after he tried to fix (the dial was broken). I will not stay here again and do not recommend it to anyone!

Title: Very disappointed

Positive_reviews: Â We upgraded to a suite & thought this would guarantee a lovely room but on arrival we couldn't have been more disappointed. The room looked dated like something from the 1970s, the wood work on the furniture was chipped and damaged, the paintwork was scuffed and skirting boards were scuffed. Bathrooms grout had black mould. I rang downstairs to ask if this was the upgraded room & was told it was & that the only other room available to move to was a standard room - which god what would that have been like. This was our first weekend away from our special needs adopted daughter in 6 years & we had wanted it to be a room we could relax & recharge in but it was upsetting instead. The staff on the Saturday sent prosecco & cake up to the room to apologise & said that the hotel was due a refurb but tbh we didn't even touch the bubbles, it couldn't fix a weekend we soo needed for restbite that had now been ruined.
Negative_reviews: Â the rooms need a massive upgrade they are extremely dated and worn out.

Title: Felt let down.  Expensive hotel and never a four star

Positive_reviews: Â Location to the Albert Docks and the various museums there;  the view of the Mersey (we had a Premium rm with river view);  the location in terms of the inner city Avis pickup point.  Bathroom was a good size and clean. Bed was comfortable.
Negative_reviews:
Â We arrived early and we knew we would have to wait until 3pm - this was discussed and acknowledged by us up front.  However, the reception staff kept advising that it MIGHT be available earlier, so we kept hanging at the hotel, being a tad travel weary.  It would have been better to have been told that the room was definitely not available until 3pm - and not raise our expectations.  Staff at reception were unfriendly and not usefully informative.   The experience did not get better from there.  The restaurant is easily the worst one we have experienced in our travels to date (4 weeks) around Europe and UK.  Rubbery and tasteless  food on the hot plates eg: scrambled eggs sitting in their own whey three breakfasts running; the best items being the sausages, bacon and tomatoes, which were at best, tepid; coffee not pleasant, sticky tables, One evening meal not available at 8.30pm on a Saturday as had run out of food - only Room Service available (?);  Fridges in room "being decommissioned", so no cold water;  all the glassware etc available ..   Here is the list we gave to Reception and left in the room as well :  Poor toilet flushing;  airconditioning unit very loud.  9 floors up, so if you turn it off, the room is too stuffy to sleep;  chair at table very unstable, looked as if it might implode when someone sat on it;  shower support loose- did not hold shower head upright or firmly;  shower door seal leaks creating a very wet floor - could slip.
See our other reviews - we very rarely have occasion to be negative.  This room, this weekend was frightful - perhaps they can do better - certainly other Radissons do.

Title: A waste of 3 days that could have been more happily spent somewhere else!

Positive_reviews: Â The staff were delightful and very helpful, and the facilities were excellent, especially the spa. It was perfectly situated near central Liverpool, with dramatic views of the Mersey. I had a luxurious room, which was large with a great view of the Mersey and a lovely big bathroom with very good toiletries. The hotel was of a beautiful design, with a breath-taking central lobby. The food, drink and choice for breakfast was excellent. The restaurant had a great ambience and design, with the food and service of a high standard. This hotel could be 5 star! I could not recommend it highly enough.
Negative_reviews: Â The layout of the food and drink for breakfast was a bit confusing and arranged slightly chaotically. It took a while to find what you wanted to eat and drink. The food in the restaurant for dinner was not quite as impressive as one would expect from the rest of the hotel; I did expect a little bit better, but only a bit. The menu was confusingly laid out and looked a bit like a pub menu!

On the Sunday evening we had room service, food was excellent, hot and plentiful, well worth the tray service charge.

Â Our check-in was very good but thereafter, it was not the best experience. We have stayed in much better Radisson blu hotels around Europe. The room was pretty basic with zero items in the mini bar. The pool in area is in desperate need of repair and the stairs to the pool are far from clean or safe - the whole feel of the pool and spa area was very tired. 
The breakfast was like something you would get at a service station. When asking for things like beans and then jam we were just told â€˜there isnâ€™t any. None at allâ€™. This was one hour before the breakfasts finished. 
The overall look in the foyer area was nice but really thatâ€™s where it stops. We have stayed in Liverpool on numerous occasions but hotels like the Hilton, Pullmanâ€™s and Malmaison are a much cleaner and better options. It would take some some revamp of staff approach and conditions to make us return.

Title: Good hotel, bit of a walk to go anywhere, service terrible

Positive_reviews: Â Breakfast was excellent
Negative_reviews:
Â The Premium room with River view (611) is quite shabby with quite a few bits of damage, one of the reading lights is intermittent, the desk lamp does not work at all. the marble desk surface has a crack all the way across it.
The TV seems only to have 5 analogue channels and the controller is intermittent.
There are no biscuits and the mini bar has nothing in it (staff advised all room fridges had been decommissioned)
The drawers have no sides so clothing falls out. 
We have already had to make a trip to reception because both the room cards stopped working. My wife got stranded in the fitness centre vestibule because the key card did not work.
We were told free lockers were available in the fitness centre, however when we got there we were told a Â£1 coin is needed to rent padlocks (the attendant did lend us 2 free when we told him we had no change).
The male toilet light was faulty.
The spa area is quite shabby with various damage and areas of bare plaster, we did not feel the area was very hygienic. The changing rooms are poorly furnished with no costume dryers, unspecified product, no obvious moisturiser or conditioner.
I raised these items with staff, they responded positively, offered a room upgrade and free breakfast. I declined the room upgrade as I didn't want to move clothing etc. for 1 night in a better room.

Title: Disappointing

Positive_reviews:
Â ARK health Centre is good.
Location was nice and central.
Lobby was clean and tidy.
Negative_reviews:
Â So first impressions of this hotel were very good, the location of the hotel is pretty good too, I requested a room with a view of the river outside and the hotel provided this.
The main lobby is very modern and clean with access into the restaurant and bar area, the check in area was a little busy but only took a few minutes to clear.
This is where we get to the bad bit... The room, from the description on the website was meant to be a really nice room.. I was visiting for birthday celebrations so naturally chose what I thought would be a nice hotel. Upon entering the room, we noted how dated the room was looking and that it was not modern to the same standard as the main lobby area.
The bed was actually quite comfortable and we had a sitting chair and a table chair along with pen, paper and a phone. The website advertised a free bottle of water in your room, this was not provided. We also wasn't informed that the mini bars in the room had been deactivated so there was no supplied stock and no where to store any chilled items we may have brought with us. The TV was a bit of a let down, it had just over 10 standard definition aerial channels, if you were lying on your bed and was trying to watch one of the channels, you would struggle due to the poor picture quality. By the windows (last couple of pictures) we have clear evidence of mold and this was one of the biggest let downs of a radisson blu hotel, I expected this to be a non-existent problem in a 4 star hotel.. How this hotel is still 4 star baffles me.
The bathroom was quite modern with a nice sink, but again we had issues with mold being around the bath and shower area. On our first night we noticed that the adjustable shower head was broken so we couldn't change the setting and the temperature was either artic or desert (freezing cold, boiling hot), there was no Inbetween.
Probably the nicest part was the downstairs spa and fitness area.
Title: Not worth 4 Stars.

Negative_reviews: Â Pool and spa facilities were poor. How to use the lift was not explained when we checked in. Television in the room was difficult to watch due to where it was located.

Title: too hot

Positive_reviews: Â Liverpool itself is a wonderful city. This is not a good hotel to see it from.
Negative_reviews:
Â When we arrived we were allocated the Wong room type - we had paid extra for the deluxe river view - we were told at first that the hotel was full and we couldnâ€™t have what we paid for. Some argument and a long wait later and we got what we paid for. 
There was only one small pillow each in the room and no robes or slippers for the spa (as advertised). We asked nicely and were told that the hotel was too full for more than one pillow each (4 star hotel ?!?!) and that we simply could not have robes. Another heated call and a wait and they appeared also. Okay so we got them but at a 4 star hotel you should not have to ask and if you do ask you should not have to complain.
The pastries and rolls at breakfast were stale and had obviously been carried over from Saturday.
When it came time to leave they made a complete mess of the taxi booking. We asked for a taxi at the required time and gave almost 2 hours notice. A taxi arrived but would not take us without a code from reception and reception had either lost or did not know about the code. So we were late to the station.
For 400 quid for 2 nights you should get better. 
Absolute shambles.

Title: Not up to 4star standard.

Positive_reviews: Â The heating was good.
Negative_reviews: Â Paid Â£224.00 on a Sunday night for what was described as fantastic prior booking with great facilities etc etc. Well I was appalled at this hotel, firstly I paid Â£224 on a Sunday night, for the best room you could get (advertised as the best on booking.com) and it was no better than a travel lodge room worth Â£25, there was no windows that opened, there was a mini bar fridge with nothing in it and was turned off an had mold all in it so we couldnâ€™t even put our own drinks in. The room was terrible it said we would have a river view hence the higher price, when really we had a steamed up window which over looked a building site. We was on the 5th floor and seen not even half the river due to cranes etc so we felt ripped off as we was in a less than standard room!! We then come to check out on Sunday and the lifts were broke so after waiting 15 minutes for a lift that never come we tried to find stairs down, well what a surprise we found stairs which took us to the basement and there was no way out, we had to walk half way back up and then walk to the lifts on another floor to get down. Â£224 is a small holiday for someone, we decided to splash out an go for the room that would make it special and it was abysmal, well over priced and I will never stay here again, not even so much as a complimentary bottle of water for Â£224.

Title: Our Trip

Positive_reviews: Â Staff were very friendly and helpful. Building looked impressive. Food was good.
Negative_reviews:
Â We booked the hotel as we were specifically looking for a 4* experience, in particular the gym, spa and pool facilities. Extremely disappointed as the steam room was out of action the entire time and the gym was closed for 2/4 days. Other areas that fell below expectation:
- lovely bar with cocktail menu: at least half of cocktails not available due to bar no longer stocking ingredients
- inadequate heating in room: despite being on max, the temperature of one of our rooms was very cool 
- toilets didn't flush properly in either room, sink was blocked in one
- fridge not working in either room
- televisions not working for the first day and intermittent fault over the next couple of days: husband had planned to stay in and watch Grand Prix, this was not possible
Staff were very friendly and tried to help, but the facilities were definitely not the 4* we were expecting, more like 2*. Won't be booking into a Radisson again.

Title: Disappointing

Positive_reviews: Â The location and the friendly girl at check in.
Negative_reviews:
Â This hotel is a disgrace, and not like any other Radisson I have stayed at. It is filthy and understaffed . The dirt in our hotel room. The balls of dust behind the bed. The broken lights in our room. The damp in our bathroom. The dirt in the bathroom. The room service tray left outside our neighbours door with remains of breakfast which was left there for 24 hours. The hotel was filthy and run down. I paid the price of a 5 star hotel and the experience was akin to something out of Faulty Towers. The two bar staff ladies who were rude, aggressive and didnt bother to serve anyone food or drinks as they were complaining about how overworked they were. A spilled drink remained on the bar / cafe floor for a good hour before anyone cleaned it up. The bar was not busy as it was early afternoon, so there was no excuse for the lack of service and the rudeness.The fact that the Reception staff seemed to be familiar with these two girls and their attitude and apologised to residents on their behalf as if they were well used to them. The man at the pool reception who said he could not give me slippers as they were running low. When I told him our room had only been stocked with one pair he made me leave the swimming pool reception and go and find housekeeping to get a pair. This took me 20 minutes while my partner waited in the pool for me.
The hotel was filthy and the service a shambles. There is also a big hole in the wall on the stairs down to the pool. This hotel would fail any health and safety test were it examined.

Prices were high (more than double the normal rate) as it was a busy weekend in Liverpool but the hotel did not pay for any extra staff to deal with full capacity.  TV reception in bedroom was very poor and was never able to get BBC1 at all, mini fridge didn't work, wardrobe handles were loose. Breakfast was chaos - not enough staff, no cutlery, tables and serving areas a mess and ran out of several items of food and condiments. I complained to Booking.com, they e mailed the hotel but the hotel didn't bother to reply!  I will NEVER stay in a Radisson Blu hotel again. Utter disgrace.

Title: Amazing

Positive_reviews: Â The reception staff were nice and welcoming especially the man who greeted us when we first got there.the trip was to celebrate our 1rst anniversary and a babymoon as I am heavily pregnant .so I was delighted to hear they had upgraded us to a business room with a river view.there was a sweet card and a dessert waiting for us in our room too.also liked the bathroom and the makeup mirror and 2 ironing boards.the bed was large and comfy too.there was a safe provided too.
Negative_reviews: Â There were 3 dealbreakers unfortunately which kind of ruined our stay.The worst one was that unlike other hotels we have stayed in, there were no charging points/ sockets anywhere near the 2 bedsidw units which I found bizarre.so no using your phonr/ tablet/ laptop lying in bed whilst its charging.this was very inconvenient and quite frankly strange for a business room.secondly one of specific reasons we chose that hotel over other 4 star hotels was the mini fridge in the room as my hubby is addicted to his fizzydrinks.unfortunately the fridge didnt work and we were told all the room fridges had been decommisioned! Despite this thry still advertise the room fridges.I had to throw away all our fruit which wrnt off overnight.heard other guests complain about this too.And the breakfast was very disappointing.We have always had lovely meat free breakfasts at other hotels.here despite the mention of fried eggs and scrambled, there were only scrambled on offer which were undercooked and runny.absolutely disgusting taste.there were no vegetarian/ quorn sausages available and no pastries/ croissants/ large cookies available as in other hotels with that rating.All this with a serving time only till 10.30 and no actual serving from staff who looked annoyed that most people choose not to have breakfast at 6 to convenience them.Add this to the heavily expensive parking available (26 pounds per day!) , very expensive massages at the spa and non working lifts, no spare pillows in rooms and no gowns/ slippers offered in spa.at nearly 300 for 2 nights we wish we had stayed in a budget hotel like premier inn or travelodge which were closer to the centre and had cheaper parking and better views.Not a patch on other similar rated hotels so avoid if you wany good value for money

Negative_reviews:
Â I spent a night here with my mum recently, and although the staff were very nice and helpful there are a few things worth knowing. The room was dark and needed bulbs replacing and we were both quite cold. A lovely Workman did come in to fix things but we never did really warm up. At 7:00 we went down to dinner and discovered that we had to wait half an hour for the chicken to cook.  Bread while we waited would be an additional three pounds. We passed on that. Looking forward to dessert we were informed that we should have ordered that with the chicken if we wanted the special two course menu. We were never informed of this and were not about to pay an additional 10 pounds for dessert.
All in all I think it would have been in everyoneâ€™s interest to make a few concessions - itâ€™s called â€œCustomer Serviceâ€.
